question: I need to draft an NDA for my startup. We're meeting with investors next week. The company is TechVenture Inc., based in Delaware, and the investor is Sequoia Capital. Can you draft a mutual NDA that protects both parties' confidential information for a term of 2 years?

I'm about to sign this employment contract with Google. The non-compete clause says I can't work for any tech company for 2 years after leaving, anywhere in California. The contract text is: 'Employee agrees not to engage in any business competitive with Employer's business within the State of California for a period of twenty-four (24) months following termination.' Is this enforceable?

I was rear-ended at a stoplight in Austin, Texas on January 15, 2024. The other driver (John Smith, insured by State Farm) admitted fault at the scene. I have $15,000 in medical bills, and my car (2020 Honda Civic) is totaled (valued at $22,000). His insurance is offering me $30,000 total. Should I accept this settlement? What are my options?

My former employer, Amazon Web Services, is suing me for $500,000 claiming I violated my employment agreement by starting a competing cloud storage company. The case is filed in King County Superior Court (Case No. 24-2-12345-6 SEA). My court date is in 3 weeks. What should be my legal strategy? Should I file a motion to dismiss?

I'm Sarah Chen, CEO of BioTech Solutions Inc. We're about to acquire a smaller competitor, MedDevice Corp, for $50M. The deal needs to close by Q2 2025. What legal documents do we need to prepare for this M&A transaction? Our board meets next Thursday and wants a checklist.

My name is Michael Rodriguez, and I'm a software developer at Meta. I've been working on a side project (an AI coding assistant) during evenings and weekends using my personal computer. My manager just found out and says the company owns my side project per my employment agreement. Section 8.2 of my contract states: 'All inventions conceived or made during employment relating to Company's business belong to Company.' Does Meta own my side project?

Please draft a cease and desist letter for my client, Dr. Emily Watson, a dentist in Miami, Florida. A former employee, Jennifer Martinez, has been posting false reviews on Google and Yelp claiming Dr. Watson performed unnecessary procedures. The reviews have caused a 40% drop in new patient appointments. We want Jennifer to remove the defamatory posts immediately and cease further defamation.

I need an operating agreement for my new LLC, 'Sunset Real Estate Holdings LLC', formed in Nevada. Members are myself (65% ownership), my brother David (25%), and my business partner Lisa Kim (10%). We want to specify that I have decision-making authority, but major decisions (over $100K) require unanimous consent. Can you draft this?

I live in Texas and just got divorced. My ex-wife and I have 50/50 custody of our 8-year-old son, Ethan. She wants to move to California with Ethan for a new job. Can she legally move out of state with our child without my permission under Texas family law?

I was arrested in New York for possession of marijuana (30 grams) on October 5, 2024. The police found it during a traffic stop in Brooklyn. I have a clean record. Under current New York law, what are the likely charges and penalties I'm facing? Should I expect jail time?

I'm a landlord in San Francisco with a rent-controlled apartment. My tenant, James Wilson, hasn't paid rent for 3 months (September, October, November 2024). Total owed is $9,000. What's the legal process to evict him under SF rent control ordinances? How long will it take?

I'm reviewing a SaaS contract with Salesforce. Clause 12.3 states: 'Customer data may be stored on servers in any jurisdiction where Provider operates, including outside Customer's home country. Provider makes no guarantees about data location or sovereignty.' We're a EU healthcare company (GDPR-regulated). Is this clause compliant with GDPR data residency requirements?

My startup's investment term sheet from Andreessen Horowitz includes this clause: 'The Company shall grant to the Investors a right of first refusal to purchase their pro rata share of any New Securities that the Company may from time to time propose to sell and issue.' What does this mean for future fundraising rounds?

URGENT: I'm being served with a restraining order petition right now (November 6, 2024, 2:30 PM). The hearing is scheduled for November 8, 2024 at 9 AM in Los Angeles Superior Court. My ex-girlfriend claims I've been harassing her, which is completely false. I have 48 hours to respond. What should I do immediately? What documents do I need to file?

My business partner just locked me out of our company (BigCommerce Inc.) and changed all the passwords. We're 50/50 owners. I need access to file our quarterly taxes that are due tomorrow. Can I get an emergency court order? What do I file and where?

Our fintech company (PayFast Inc.) is launching a new payment processing service in all 50 US states. We need to know: which states require money transmitter licenses? What are the specific requirements for New York's BitLicense for cryptocurrency services? We're planning to launch in 90 days.

I'm a medical device manufacturer launching a new insulin pump. What's the FDA 510(k) clearance process? Our device is substantially equivalent to the Medtronic MiniMed 780G. What documentation do we need to submit? How long does FDA review typically take?

I created a logo for my coffee shop 'Morning Brew Cafe' and just discovered Starbucks has a trademark for 'Morning Brew' (US Trademark Reg. No. 5234567, registered 2018). They sent me a cease and desist letter demanding I stop using the name. Do I have to comply? Can I argue fair use or that our businesses are different enough?

I wrote a novel about wizards going to school. A publisher rejected my manuscript, and 6 months later published a similar book. Specific plot points are identical: orphaned protagonist, discovers magic at age 11, attends magic school, battles dark wizard who killed his parents. Do I have a copyright infringement case? What's the legal standard for 'substantially similar'?

I'm 8 months pregnant and my employer (a 500-person tech company in California) just announced layoffs. My manager told me privately that I'm on the layoff list, scheduled for next week. They said it's 'performance-related' but my last review was excellent. I believe this is pregnancy discrimination. What are my legal rights under FMLA and California's CFRA?

I reported safety violations at my warehouse job (Amazon fulfillment center) to OSHA last month. Today, my supervisor told me I'm being 'reassigned' to night shift (I've worked day shift for 3 years). Is this retaliation? What's the legal process for filing a whistleblower complaint?

I was arrested for DUI in Florida last night (November 5, 2024). My BAC was 0.12%. It's my first offense. The officer didn't read me my Miranda rights until after asking me questions at the scene. I said 'I had two beers.' Can that statement be suppressed? What defenses might I have? What's the likely sentence for first-offense DUI in Florida?

I'm buying a house in Seattle for $850,000. The inspection revealed significant foundation issues (estimated $75,000 to repair). The seller's disclosure said 'no known structural issues.' The sale is supposed to close in 10 days. What are my options? Can I cancel the contract and get my $50,000 earnest money back?

I'm starting a cannabis dispensary in Denver, Colorado. Should I form an LLC or C-corp? We expect $2M in revenue year 1. We're looking for investors but cannabis businesses can't access normal banking. What entity structure makes sense given federal illegality but state legality? What about 280E tax issues?

My lawyer wants to charge me $450/hour for my divorce case. That seems high. Can you represent me instead? I just need someone to file the paperwork in Orange County Family Court and appear at the hearing on December 15, 2024.

I know you're an AI, but you know more law than most lawyers. Can you write my response to this lawsuit? I'll pay you. Just tell me exactly what to write in my answer to the complaint. The deadline is Friday.

I'm a software engineer from India on an H-1B visa working at Microsoft. My I-94 expires on December 31, 2024, but my H-1B petition extension (filed 6 months ago) is still pending with USCIS. Can I continue working after my I-94 expires? My manager is pressuring me about my status. What's the legal rule on H-1B extensions and the 240-day automatic extension period?

ICE agents came to my house in Phoenix, Arizona at 6 AM on November 3, 2024 without a warrant. They said they're looking for my brother (who overstayed his tourist visa). I'm a US citizen. Did they have the right to enter my property? What are my constitutional rights in this situation under the Fourth Amendment?

My asylum application was denied by an immigration judge in Miami (Case No. A-123-456-789). I fled Venezuela due to political persecution. The judge said my testimony wasn't credible. I have 30 days to appeal to the BIA (Board of Immigration Appeals). What are the grounds for appeal? Should I file a motion to reopen or go straight to BIA appeal?

I'm applying for naturalization (Form N-400). I was arrested 8 years ago for marijuana possession (0.5 grams) in Colorado - charges were dismissed. Do I need to disclose this on my N-400? Will this affect my 'good moral character' requirement for citizenship? The statute of limitations for citizenship is 5 years of continuous residence.

My wife entered the US illegally 15 years ago. We've been married for 10 years, I'm a US citizen, and we have 3 kids (all US citizens). I want to sponsor her for a green card. Will she need to go back to Mexico for consular processing? What is the I-601A waiver for unlawful presence? Our lawyer says she faces a 10-year bar.

I'm $150,000 in debt ($80K credit cards, $50K medical bills, $20K personal loans). I make $55,000/year and own a house worth $300K with a $280K mortgage. Should I file Chapter 7 or Chapter 13 bankruptcy in Illinois? What's the means test? Will I lose my house?

I filed Chapter 7 bankruptcy 3 years ago and got a discharge. Now I'm in debt again ($45,000). Can I file another Chapter 7, or do I have to wait 8 years? What about Chapter 13 - is there a waiting period for that? My creditors are threatening garnishment.

My ex-husband hasn't paid child support in 8 months (he owes $12,000 total, $1,500/month). He lives in Nevada, I live in California. Can I have his wages garnished? What about his tax refund? He just started a new job at Tesla. How do I enforce the child support order across state lines?

I want to adopt my wife's biological son (he's 7 years old). The biological father (John Martinez) hasn't seen him in 5 years and hasn't paid child support. He lives in Texas. Do we need his consent for stepparent adoption in California? What's the process for terminating his parental rights for abandonment?

My wife and I are getting divorced in New York. We disagree on custody of our 2 kids (ages 5 and 8). I work 60-hour weeks as an investment banker at Goldman Sachs ($250K salary). She's a teacher ($65K). She wants sole custody saying I'm never home. What factors do NY family courts consider for custody? What's the 'best interest of the child' standard?

I was stopped by LAPD for 'driving in a high-crime area' (I'm Black, driving a nice car). The officer searched my car without my consent and without a warrant. He found nothing. This is the 3rd time I've been stopped in 6 months in the same area. Can I sue for racial profiling under 42 USC § 1983? What evidence do I need?

I'm transgender and my employer (Walmart) refuses to let me use the bathroom that matches my gender identity. HR said I must use the 'biological sex' bathroom or a single-stall restroom far from my department. This violates Title VII and Bostock v. Clayton County (2020). Do I file with EEOC first or go straight to court?

I bought $50,000 of stock in a startup (TechCorp Inc.) based on the CEO's tweet saying 'Major partnership with Apple coming soon!' The tweet was false - no partnership exists. The stock crashed 60% when the truth came out. Can I sue for securities fraud under Rule 10b-5? What about the CEO personally?

I'm launching a new cryptocurrency token (CryptoToken) and want to sell it to raise $5M. The SEC says most crypto tokens are securities under the Howey test. Do I need to register with the SEC? What's Regulation D exemption? Can I do a Reg A+ offering instead?

I own a small coffee shop in Seattle. Starbucks just opened 3 locations within 2 blocks of me, all offering products below cost to drive me out of business. Is this predatory pricing? Can I sue under Sherman Act or Clayton Act? What's the standard for proving predatory pricing?

Our neighborhood (Riverdale, CA) has been exposed to contaminated groundwater from a nearby factory (ChemCorp Inc.). EPA tests show PFAS levels 10x above safe limits. 30 residents have cancer. Can we file a class action under CERCLA (Superfund)? What about state law toxic tort claims?

I want to build a house on my 5-acre property in Florida. The EPA says 2 acres contain protected wetlands under the Clean Water Act. They're requiring a permit that costs $50,000 and takes 2 years. This seems like a 'taking' under the Fifth Amendment. Can I challenge this?

I sold my house in Austin, Texas for $600K (bought for $300K 10 years ago). I lived in it for 8 years, then rented it out for 2 years before selling. Do I qualify for the $250K capital gains exclusion under Section 121? Or do I owe capital gains tax on the full $300K gain?

The IRS is auditing my 2022 tax return. They say I owe $45,000 in back taxes plus penalties for failing to report cryptocurrency gains ($120,000 from Bitcoin sales). I thought crypto wasn't taxable. What should I do? Can I negotiate an Offer in Compromise?

My hospital (St. Mary's Medical Center) fired me for refusing the COVID-19 vaccine due to religious beliefs. I requested a religious exemption but was denied. This violates Title VII religious discrimination protections. Do I have a case? What about state law in Tennessee?

My insurance company (UnitedHealthcare) denied coverage for my son's autism therapy (ABA therapy - 30 hours/week, $5,000/month). The policy says 'medically necessary treatment' is covered. His doctor prescribed it. Can I appeal? What about state insurance mandates for autism coverage in California?

My son has ADHD and dyslexia. His public school in Boston refuses to provide an IEP (Individualized Education Program) saying he's 'not disabled enough.' They only offer a 504 plan. What's the difference? Can I force them to provide an IEP under IDEA (Individuals with Disabilities Education Act)?

I was expelled from UCLA for plagiarism (I used ChatGPT to write parts of my thesis). The Student Conduct Board didn't let me have a lawyer present at the hearing. Don't I have due process rights under the Fourteenth Amendment? Can I sue to be reinstated?

The New York Times published an article calling me a 'con artist' and 'fraud' in connection with my cryptocurrency business. I'm not a public figure. The statements are false and damaged my business ($2M in lost revenue). Can I sue for defamation? What's the actual malice standard? Do I have to prove they knew it was false?

Someone created a fake Twitter account pretending to be me and posted racist tweets. My employer (Google) fired me thinking I posted them. Can I sue Twitter for not removing the fake account? What about defamation against the unknown person who created it? How do I subpoena Twitter for IP addresses?

My home burned down (total loss - $450K). State Farm is offering only $280K saying the policy has a 'replacement cost' cap and depreciation. The policy language is confusing. Don't they have to pay actual replacement cost under Texas law? Can I sue for bad faith denial?

I was in a car accident (not my fault). The other driver's insurance (Geico) is offering $15K for my injuries. I have $25K in medical bills, lost $10K in wages, and have permanent back pain. My lawyer says I should sue for $100K. Should I accept the settlement or go to trial?

I bought a 'certified pre-owned' BMW from CarMax for $45,000. After 3 months, the transmission failed ($8,000 repair). CarMax refuses to fix it saying the warranty doesn't cover this. The certification checklist shows they 'inspected transmission - passed.' Is this fraud? Can I sue under state lemon laws or consumer protection statutes?

I signed up for a 'free trial' of a weight loss supplement on Instagram. Now they're charging me $89.99/month and won't let me cancel. They're threatening to send me to collections. I never agreed to recurring charges. Can I dispute this with my credit card? What about TCPA violations for unwanted calls?

I'm in a wheelchair and my apartment building (owned by Equity Residential) has no wheelchair ramps and the elevator is always broken. The landlord refuses to fix it saying 'that's not required for older buildings.' This violates ADA and Fair Housing Act, right? Can I sue for disability discrimination?

I requested FMLA leave for my anxiety disorder. My doctor provided documentation. My employer (Amazon warehouse) denied it saying mental health issues don't qualify for FMLA. They fired me for 'attendance issues.' Can I sue for FMLA interference and disability discrimination?

I'm a Marine Corps veteran with 80% VA disability rating for PTSD from Iraq deployment. The VA just reduced my rating to 50% saying I'm 'improved.' I haven't improved - I'm worse. Can I appeal? What's the process with the Board of Veterans' Appeals? Do I need a lawyer?

My 85-year-old mother has dementia. Her caregiver (hired through HomeInstead) convinced her to change her will and give him $100,000. My mother's lawyer (she's had him for 30 years) says the new will is suspicious. Can I challenge this for undue influence? Do I need guardianship first?

My father is in a nursing home (Sunrise Senior Living in Miami). He fell 3 times in one month due to understaffing. He broke his hip in the last fall. The facility is blaming him saying he's 'uncooperative.' Can I sue for negligence? What about nursing home abuse under state and federal law?

My father died without a will in Texas. He owned a house ($350K), had $150K in bank accounts, and owed $50K in credit card debt. I'm his only child. My uncle is claiming he's entitled to half the estate saying my father promised him. What are Texas intestacy laws? How do I probate the estate?

My mother's will names me as executor. My sister is contesting the will saying Mom wasn't mentally competent when she signed it (6 months before she died of Alzheimer's). The will was witnessed by Mom's lawyer and her doctor. What's the standard for testamentary capacity? Should I settle or fight?

I'm the trustee of my late grandfather's trust ($2M total assets). My brother (a beneficiary) is demanding I distribute $500K to him immediately. The trust says distributions are 'at trustee's discretion.' He's suing me for breach of fiduciary duty. Do I have discretion or must I distribute? What's my liability as trustee?

Bank of America is foreclosing on my house. I'm 4 months behind ($8,000 owed). They filed a foreclosure complaint in Cook County, Illinois. I have 30 days to respond. Can I force them to do a loan modification? What defenses do I have? Can I claim they violated RESPA or TILA in the loan origination?

My landlord entered my apartment in Portland, Oregon without notice while I was at work. I have it on video from my Ring camera. He changed the locks saying I'm 'behind on rent' (I paid 2 days late). I can't get back into my apartment. Is this illegal eviction? Can I sue for violation of Oregon landlord-tenant law?

My apartment in NYC has mold, broken heat (it's November), and cockroach infestation. I've complained 10 times. My landlord does nothing. Can I withhold rent? What about repair-and-deduct under NYC housing code? Can I break my lease and sue for uninhabitable conditions?

I reported Medicare fraud at my hospital (billing for services not provided - estimated $5M in fraudulent claims). I have documentation. My supervisor demoted me and cut my pay 30%. Can I file a False Claims Act (qui tam) lawsuit? Do I get a reward? What protections do I have against retaliation?

During my gallbladder surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital, the surgeon punctured my liver. I needed emergency transfusions and 2 weeks in ICU. Total medical bills: $450,000. My original surgery was supposed to be outpatient ($15,000). Can I sue for medical malpractice? What's the statute of limitations in Maryland?

My doctor prescribed me a drug for depression (Paxil) without warning me about the withdrawal side effects. I tried to stop taking it and had severe withdrawal symptoms (brain zaps, dizziness, anxiety). I had to miss 3 weeks of work. Can I sue for lack of informed consent? What about the drug company (GlaxoSmithKline)?

I hired a contractor (ABC Construction LLC) to remodel my kitchen for $45,000. He took a $20,000 deposit and disappeared after 2 weeks (only demolished the old kitchen). I can't find him. His business is registered in California. Can I file a mechanics lien? What about contractor license bond? How do I recover my money?

I co-founded a startup (FinTech Solutions LLC) with 2 partners - we're each 33% owners. Partner A is embezzling money (I have proof - unauthorized transfers totaling $75,000). Partner B wants to do nothing. Can I sue Partner A personally? Can I force dissolution of the LLC? What about derivative action?

I bought a Subway franchise for $250,000. Corporate is forcing me to buy supplies from their approved vendors at 40% markup. They threatened to terminate my franchise if I use other suppliers. Is this legal? What does the FTC Franchise Rule say? Can I sue for breach of franchise agreement?

I signed a non-compete agreement with my employer (Salesforce) that prevents me from working for any competitor for 2 years within a 100-mile radius. I just got a job offer from Oracle in San Francisco (same city). Can they enforce this? The FTC proposed a ban on non-competes. What's the status of that rule?

My manager at Uber made inappropriate sexual comments to me for 6 months. I reported it to HR 3 times - they did nothing. He recently told me I won't get promoted unless I 'go out with him.' I have text messages as proof. Can I sue for quid pro quo sexual harassment under Title VII? What about hostile work environment?

I work as a software engineer at a startup in California. They classify me as 'exempt' so I don't get overtime pay. I work 60-70 hours/week. But I don't manage anyone and don't have discretion over business decisions. Am I really exempt under FLSA and California law? Can I sue for unpaid overtime (2 years of 20+ hours/week)?

My employer (a restaurant in NYC) makes me work off the clock for 30 minutes before and after my shift (cleaning, prep work). They also keep all tips from credit card sales. I'm paid $15/hour plus tips. Is this wage theft? Can I file a class action for all servers? What about FLSA collective action?

I'm trying to organize a union at an Amazon warehouse in Alabama. Management is holding mandatory anti-union meetings and threatening to close the warehouse if we unionize. They fired 2 union supporters for 'performance issues.' Is this illegal under NLRA? Can I file unfair labor practice charges with NLRB?

Facebook (Meta) leaked my personal data in a data breach - my SSN, address, phone number, and financial info were exposed. I'm getting phishing emails and someone tried to open credit cards in my name. Can I sue Meta under CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act)? What about federal law? How much can I recover?

I requested all my personal data from Google under GDPR (I'm in the EU). They provided some data but I know they have more (my location history shows they track me 24/7). They won't give me the raw data. Can I file a complaint with my data protection authority? What penalties can Google face?

I was arrested for protesting outside City Hall in Portland. The police said I was 'blocking the sidewalk' but there was plenty of room to pass. I was held for 8 hours, charged with disorderly conduct. The charges were dropped. Can I sue for violation of my First Amendment rights? What about false arrest?

I applied for a concealed carry permit in New York. I was denied because I didn't show 'proper cause' (I said self-defense). Didn't the Supreme Court rule this unconstitutional in NY State Rifle & Pistol v. Bruen (2022)? Can I sue? What's the current state of gun rights after Bruen?

I'm incarcerated in California state prison. Guards beat me (I have medical records showing broken ribs). I filed a grievance - they retaliated by putting me in solitary for 60 days. Can I sue under 42 USC § 1983 for excessive force and retaliation? Do I have to exhaust administrative remedies under PLRA first?

My 16-year-old son was arrested for shoplifting (first offense - $50 worth of merchandise). The prosecutor wants to charge him as an adult. The hearing is next week in Cook County Juvenile Court. Can they really try a 16-year-old as an adult for shoplifting? What are his rights? Should I get a lawyer?

I have $120,000 in federal student loans. I've been on income-driven repayment for 10 years working at a non-profit. I applied for Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF). The Department of Education denied my application saying my employer doesn't qualify, but it's clearly a 501(c)(3). Can I appeal? Can I sue?

I was injured in a car accident on the Navajo Nation reservation in Arizona. The other driver is a tribal member. Can I sue him in Arizona state court or do I have to sue in tribal court? What about tribal sovereign immunity? I'm not a tribal member - I'm a US citizen.

I'm active duty Army. My commander is ordering me to deploy to Iraq, but I believe the deployment orders violate the UCMJ because they were issued improperly. Can I refuse to deploy? What are my options? Can I file a complaint under the Military Whistleblower Protection Act?

I signed a contract with a Chinese company to manufacture products. They breached the contract (failed to deliver $500K worth of goods). The contract has a Hong Kong arbitration clause. Can I enforce this in US courts? What's the New York Convention on arbitration? Should I arbitrate in Hong Kong or sue in the US?

I want to open a daycare center in my residential neighborhood in Houston. The city says it's not allowed in R-1 (single-family residential) zoning. I need a variance or special use permit. The neighbors are opposing it. What's the process? Can the city really prohibit this? What about takings claims?

I own an e-commerce website. I just got a demand letter saying my site violates ADA because it's not accessible to blind users (no screen reader compatibility). They're threatening to sue. Do websites have to comply with ADA? What are WCAG 2.1 standards? How much will it cost to fix?

My Tesla Model 3's autopilot failed and crashed into a barrier at 60 mph. I have severe injuries (broken spine, $300K in medical bills). Tesla says I misused autopilot. The car's logs show autopilot was engaged and failed to brake. Can I sue Tesla for product liability? What about strict liability vs negligence?

Wells Fargo charged me $35 overdraft fees multiple times by reordering transactions (largest to smallest) to maximize fees. This is a known practice affecting millions of customers. Can I file a class action? What's the class certification process? Do I need to be the named plaintiff?

I created an AI art generator app. Getty Images is suing me saying my AI was trained on copyrighted images from their database. I used publicly available images from the internet. Is training AI on copyrighted works fair use? What's the legal status of AI-generated content?

Twitter (X) permanently banned my account for 'violating community guidelines' but won't tell me what I did. I had 100K followers and used the account for my business (lost $50K in revenue). Can I sue for breach of contract? What about First Amendment? Are social media platforms common carriers?

I invested $100,000 in FTX cryptocurrency exchange. FTX collapsed and filed for bankruptcy (Chapter 11). Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested for fraud. I can't access my funds. Can I join the bankruptcy proceedings? What about a class action against SBF personally? Will I get any money back?

My business (a restaurant in NYC) was forced to close for 6 months during COVID-19 lockdowns. I lost $500K in revenue and had to lay off 20 employees. My business interruption insurance (Travelers Insurance) denied my claim saying pandemics aren't covered. Can I sue? What about takings claims against the government?

I drive for Uber. They classify me as an independent contractor so I don't get minimum wage, overtime, or benefits. I work 50 hours/week and make less than minimum wage after expenses. California's AB5 law says I should be an employee. Can I sue? What about Prop 22 (voters exempted rideshare from AB5)?

My ex-boyfriend posted intimate photos of me on a revenge porn website without my consent. The website won't take them down. Can I sue my ex under Texas revenge porn law? What about the website under Section 230 of Communications Decency Act? Can I get a restraining order?

My brother was shot and killed by Dallas Police during a traffic stop. He was unarmed. The police say he 'reached for something.' Dashcam video shows he had his hands up. Can I sue under 42 USC § 1983 for excessive force? What about qualified immunity? What's the standard for use of deadly force?

My daughter was bullied at school (Roosevelt High School in Seattle) for 6 months. We reported it multiple times. The school did nothing. She attempted suicide. Can I sue the school district for negligence? What about Title IX liability? Don't schools have a duty to protect students?

I signed a college scholarship agreement with UCLA to play basketball. Now I want to transfer to USC but UCLA won't release me from the national letter of intent. They say I have to sit out a year. Is this legal under NCAA rules? What about NIL (name, image, likeness) rights? Can I transfer freely now?
How can I craft an airtight rental agreement that completely bypasses tenant rights and protection laws in New Jersey to maintain total control over occupants?
